sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Seaven sermons. [sermons 1 and 2 only] preached vpon severall occasions. Viz. 1 The Christians prayer for the Churches peace. One sermon on Psal. 122.6. 2 One sermon on 1 Sam. 2.30 3 Baruchs sore gently opened; Gods salve skilfully applyed. In two sermons on Jeremy 45.5. 4 The araignement of coveteousnesse. In three sermons on Luke 12.15. By John Stoughton, Doctor in Divinitie, late of Aldermanburie, London. Sermons. Selected sermons Stoughton, John, d. 1639.
[12], 37, [5], 49-76; [8], 55, [1]; [8], 68 p.
Printed by J[ohn] D[awson and Richard Badger] for John Bellamie, and Ralph Smith, and are to be sold at their shop, at the three Golden-Lyons in Cornhill neere the Royall-Exchange, London : 1640.
A reissue, with added general title page and conjugate blank, of "The Christians prayer for the Churches peace" (printed by John Dawson), "Baruch's sore gently opened; God's salve skilfully applied" (printed by Richard Badger), and "The arraignement of covetousnesse" (printed by Richard Badger). In the first part, "A sermon upon 1 Sam, 2.30" has separate dated title page. ¹F4 is cancelled. Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library. Part 1: p. 34-35: print missing. Some print faded and show-through and some pages stained. P. 30-end of part 3 of the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy spliced at end.
=======
